csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Chaikin Volatility
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// Measures the expansion and contraction of the High-Low range.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>1. Calculate EMA of High-Low Diff.</description></item>
13 /// <item><description>2. Calculate Rate of Change (ROC) of that EMA.</description></item>
14 /// </list>
15 /// </remarks>
16 public class ChaikinVolatility
17 {
18 public int EmaPeriod { get; }
19 public int RocPeriod { get; }
20 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
21​
22 public ChaikinVolatility(int emaPeriod = 10, int rocPeriod = 10)
23 {
24 EmaPeriod = emaPeriod;
25 RocPeriod = rocPeriod;
26 }
27​
28 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
29 {
30 Values.Clear();
31 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
32 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
33​
34 // Step 1: Calculate High-Low Ranges
35 var ranges = new List<decimal>();
36 foreach (var c in candleList)
37 ranges.Add(c.High - c.Low);
38​
39 // Step 2: Calculate EMA of Ranges
40 var ema = CalculateEma(ranges, EmaPeriod);
41​
42 // Step 3: Calculate ROC of EMA
43 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
44 {
45 if (i < RocPeriod || !ema[i].HasValue || !ema[i - RocPeriod].HasValue || ema[i - RocPeriod]!.Value == 0)
46 {
47 Values.Add(null);
48 continue;
49 }
50​
51 decimal currentEma = ema[i]!.Value;
52 decimal prevEma = ema[i - RocPeriod]!.Value;
53​
54 // Formula: (Current - Prev) / Prev * 100
55 decimal cv = ((currentEma - prevEma) / prevEma) * 100;
56 Values.Add(cv);
57 }
58 }
59​
60 private static List<decimal?> CalculateEma(List<decimal> prices, int period)
61 {
62 var results = new List<decimal?>();
63 decimal k = 2.0m / (period + 1);
64 decimal? prevEma = null;
65​
66 for (int i = 0; i < prices.Count; i++)
67 {
68 if (i < period - 1)
69 {
70 results.Add(null);
71 continue;
72 }
73​
74 if (prevEma == null)
75 {
76 decimal sum = 0;
77 for (int j = 0; j < period; j++) sum += prices[i - j];
78 prevEma = sum / period;
79 results.Add(prevEma);
80 }
81 else
82 {
83 decimal ema = (prices[i] - prevEma.Value) * k + prevEma.Value;
84 results.Add(ema);
85 prevEma = ema;
86 }
87 }
88 return results;
89 }
90​
91 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int emaPeriod = 10, int rocPeriod = 10)
92 {
93 var cv = new ChaikinVolatility(emaPeriod, rocPeriod);
94 cv.Calculate(candles);
95 return cv.Values;
96 }
97 }
98}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (ChaikinVolatility)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6// Chaikin Volatility indicator.
7//
8// [Core Concepts]
9// 1. High-Low Range
10// [Why] The simplest measure of intra-day volatility.
11// [What] Range = High - Low.
12//
13// 2. EMA Smoothing
14// [Why] Raw range is noisy. Use EMA to find the trend of volatility.
15//
16// 3. Rate of Change (ROC)
17// [Why] We want to know if volatility is *expanding* or *contracting*.
18// [What] Compare current Volatility EMA to the EMA 'n' bars ago.
19// [Formula] ((CurrentEMA - PrevEMA) / PrevEMA) * 100
20//
21// [Visual]
22// Volatility Cycle:
23//
24// Expansion (Positive CV)
25// ▲
26// │ ╱╲ High Range Days
27// │ ╱ ╲ (Market Moving)
28// └──╱────╲── Zero Line
29// ╲ (Consolidation)
30// ╲ Low Range Days
31// ▼
32// Contraction (Negative CV)
33//
34// =============================================================================
35​
36using System;
37using System.Collections.Generic;
38​
39namespace TechnicalIndicators
40{
41 // =============================================================================
42 // CandleData
43 // =============================================================================
44 public readonly record struct CandleData(
45 DateTime Timestamp,
46 decimal Open,
47 decimal High,
48 decimal Low,
49 decimal Close,
50 long Volume
51 );
52​
53 // =============================================================================
54 // ChaikinVolatility Class
55 // =============================================================================
56 public class ChaikinVolatility
57 {
58 // -------------------------------------------------------------
59 // Properties
60 // EmaPeriod: Smoothing window for the Range (default 10).
61 // RocPeriod: Comparison window for change rate (default 10).
62 // -------------------------------------------------------------
63 public int EmaPeriod { get; }
64 public int RocPeriod { get; }
65 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
66​
67 // Constructor
68 public ChaikinVolatility(int emaPeriod = 10, int rocPeriod = 10)
69 {
70 EmaPeriod = emaPeriod;
71 RocPeriod = rocPeriod;
72 }
73​
74 // =============================================================================
75 // Main Calculate Method
76 // =============================================================================
77 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
78 {
79 Values.Clear();
80 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
81 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
82​
83 // -------------------------------------------------------------
84 // Step 1: Calculate High-Low Range for each candle
85 // [Why] Raw input data for volatility.
86 // -------------------------------------------------------------
87 var highLow = new List<decimal>();
88 foreach (var c in candleList)
89 {
90 highLow.Add(c.High - c.Low);
91 }
92​
93 // -------------------------------------------------------------
94 // Step 2: Smooth the Range using EMA
95 // [Why] Reduce noise to see the underlying volatility trend.
96 // -------------------------------------------------------------
97 var ema = CalculateEma(highLow, EmaPeriod);
98​
99 // -------------------------------------------------------------
100 // Step 3: Calculate ROC of the EMA
101 // [Why] Determine if volatility is increasing or decreasing.
102 // -------------------------------------------------------------
103 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
104 {
105 // ---------------------------------------------------------
106 // Guard Checks:
107 // 1. i < RocPeriod: Not enough history to look back 'n' bars.
108 // 2. !ema[i]: Current EMA not calculated yet (warm-up).
109 // 3. !ema[i-Roc]: Past EMA is null.
110 // 4. ema[i-Roc] == 0: Cannot divide by zero.
111 // ---------------------------------------------------------
112 if (i < RocPeriod ||
113 !ema[i].HasValue ||
114 !ema[i - RocPeriod].HasValue ||
115 ema[i - RocPeriod]!.Value == 0)
116 {
117 Values.Add(null);
118 continue;
119 }
120​
121 // ---------------------------------------------------------
122 // Calculation: ROC Formula
123 // (Current - Past) / Past * 100
124 // ---------------------------------------------------------
125 decimal currentVal = ema[i]!.Value;
126 decimal pastVal = ema[i - RocPeriod]!.Value;
127​
128 decimal cv = ((currentVal - pastVal) / pastVal) * 100;
129 Values.Add(cv);
130 }
131 }
132​
133 // =============================================================================
134 // IPO: CalculateEma
135 // =============================================================================
136 //
137 // [Input]
138 // - prices: List<decimal> (The raw High-Low ranges)
139 // - period: int (Smoothing period, e.g., 10)
140 //
141 // [Process]
142 // 1. Determine Smoothing Factor k = 2 / (period + 1).
143 // 2. Iterate through price list.
144 // 3. Warm-up: First (period-1) values are null.
145 // 4. Initialization: At index (period-1), calculate SMA as the seed.
146 // 5. EMA Loop: PreviousEMA + (CurrentPrice - PreviousEMA) * k.
147 //
148 // [Output]
149 // - List<decimal?>: The smoothed series.
150 //
151 // [Visual]
152 // Range Data: 5 3 4 6 8 ...
153 // Index 0-8: null... (Waiting for 10 periods)
154 // Index 9: Initial SMA (Avg of 0-9)
155 // Index 10: EMA Formula applied
156 // =============================================================================
157 private static List<decimal?> CalculateEma(List<decimal> prices, int period)
158 {
159 var results = new List<decimal?>();
160 decimal k = 2.0m / (period + 1);
161 decimal? prevEma = null;
162​
163 for (int i = 0; i < prices.Count; i++)
164 {
165 // Case A: Insufficient data
166 if (i < period - 1)
167 {
168 results.Add(null);
169 continue;
170 }
171​
172 // Case B: Initialization (SMA Seed)
173 if (i == period - 1)
174 {
175 decimal sum = 0;
176 for (int j = 0; j < period; j++)
177 sum += prices[i - j];
178
179 prevEma = sum / period;
180 results.Add(prevEma);
181 continue;
182 }
183​
184 // Case C: EMA Calculation
185 if (prevEma != null)
186 {
187 decimal ema = (prices[i] - prevEma.Value) * k + prevEma.Value;
188 results.Add(ema);
189 prevEma = ema;
190 }
191 else
192 {
193 // Should theoretically not reach here if logic holds
194 results.Add(null);
195 }
196 }
197 return results;
198 }
199​
200 // =============================================================================
201 // Static Wrapper
202 // =============================================================================
203 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int emaPeriod = 10, int rocPeriod = 10)
204 {
205 var cv = new ChaikinVolatility(emaPeriod, rocPeriod);
206 cv.Calculate(candles);
207 return cv.Values;
208 }
209 }
210}
python_simple:
1class ChaikinVolatility:
2 """
3 Chaikin Volatility
4 ROC( EMA(High-Low), Period )
5 """
6 def __init__(self, ema_period=10, roc_period=10):
7 self.ema_period = ema_period
8 self.roc_period = roc_period
9 self.values = []
10​
11 def calculate(self, candles):
12 self.values.clear()
13 if len(candles) == 0: return
14​
15 # 1. Ranges
16 ranges = [c['high'] - c['low'] for c in candles]
17​
18 # 2. EMA
19 ema = self._ema(ranges, self.ema_period)
20​
21 # 3. ROC
22 for i in range(len(candles)):
23 if i < self.roc_period or ema[i] is None or ema[i - self.roc_period] is None:
24 self.values.append(None)
25 continue
26
27 curr = ema[i]
28 prev = ema[i - self.roc_period]
29
30 if prev == 0:
31 self.values.append(0.0)
32 else:
33 self.values.append(((curr - prev) / prev) * 100)
34​
35 def _ema(self, source, period):
36 res = []
37 k = 2 / (period + 1)
38 prev = None
39 for i in range(len(source)):
40 if i < period - 1:
41 res.append(None)
42 continue
43 if prev is None:
44 prev = sum(source[i-period+1 : i+1]) / period
45 res.append(prev)
46 else:
47 prev = (source[i] - prev) * k + prev
48 res.append(prev)
49 return res
50​
51def calculate(candles, ema_period=10, roc_period=10):
52 cv = ChaikinVolatility(ema_period, roc_period)
53 cv.calculate(candles)
54 return cv.values
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (ChaikinVolatility)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Chaikin Volatility indicator. We explain *why* code is written this way
7# and *how* data transforms line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
8#
9# [Core Concepts]
10# 1. Range-Based Volatility
11# Uses High-Low range as volatility measure.
12# Unlike ATR (which uses True Range), this is simpler—no gap consideration.
13#
14# 2. EMA Smoothing
15# Apply EMA to the High-Low range for stability.
16#
17# 3. Rate of Change
18# CV = ((EMA[today] - EMA[n days ago]) / EMA[n days ago]) × 100
19# Measures how much volatility has changed as a percentage.
20#
21# [Trading Interpretation]
22# - High positive CV: Volatility expanding rapidly
23# - High negative CV: Volatility contracting rapidly
24# - Near zero: Stable volatility
25#
26# =============================================================================
27​
28​
29# -------------------------------------------------------------
30# Type-Level Explanation: ChaikinVolatility (class)
31#
32# [Why] Two-parameter design: EMA period and ROC lookback.
33# Separate periods allow fine-tuning responsiveness.
34#
35# [What] Measures rate of change in smoothed price range.
36# Output is percentage change in volatility.
37#
38# [Who] Volatility breakout traders, options traders, timing entries.
39#
40# [Where] Heap allocation - stores result list.
41# -------------------------------------------------------------
42class ChaikinVolatility:
43​
44 # -------------------------------------------------------------
45 # Constructor: __init__
46 #
47 # [Why] Two periods for different purposes.
48 # ema_period: How much to smooth the range
49 # roc_period: How far back to compare
50 # -------------------------------------------------------------
51 def __init__(self, ema_period=10, roc_period=10):
52 # -------------------------------------------------------------
53 # Logic Step 1: Parameter Validation
54 #
55 # [Decision]
56 # Are parameters positive?
57 #
58 # [True Branch: Invalid]
59 # Raise ValueError.
60 #
61 # [False Branch: Valid]
62 # Set properties.
63 # -------------------------------------------------------------
64 if ema_period <= 0 or roc_period <= 0:
65 raise ValueError("Periods must be positive")
66​
67 self.ema_period = ema_period
68 self.roc_period = roc_period
69 self.values = []
70​
71​
72 # =============================================================================
73 # IPO: calculate
74 # =============================================================================
75 #
76 # [Input]
77 # - candles: list[dict] - Each dict has 'high', 'low' keys.
78 #
79 # [Process]
80 # 1. Calculate High-Low range for each bar
81 # 2. Calculate EMA of the range
82 # 3. Calculate ROC of the EMA
83 #
84 # [Output]
85 # - None (results stored in self.values)
86 # =============================================================================
87 def calculate(self, candles):
88​
89 # -------------------------------------------------------------
90 # Logic Step 1: State Reset
91 # -------------------------------------------------------------
92 self.values.clear()
93​
94 # -------------------------------------------------------------
95 # Logic Step 2: Empty Input Guard
96 # -------------------------------------------------------------
97 if len(candles) == 0:
98 return
99​
100 # -------------------------------------------------------------
101 # Logic Step 3: Calculate High-Low Ranges
102 #
103 # [Why] (Intent)
104 # Simple volatility proxy. Each bar's range = High - Low.
105 # -------------------------------------------------------------
106 high_low = [c['high'] - c['low'] for c in candles]
107​
108 # -------------------------------------------------------------
109 # Logic Step 4: Calculate EMA of Ranges
110 #
111 # [Why] (Intent)
112 # Smooth the noisy raw ranges.
113 # -------------------------------------------------------------
114 ema = self._calc_ema(high_low, self.ema_period)
115​
116 # -------------------------------------------------------------
117 # Logic Step 5: Calculate Rate of Change
118 #
119 # [Why] (Intent)
120 # Compare current smoothed volatility to past smoothed volatility.
121 # ROC = ((Current - Past) / Past) × 100
122 #
123 # [Visual]
124 # roc_period = 10
125 # EMA: [2.0, 2.1, 2.3, ..., 2.8, 3.5]
126 # ↑ ↑
127 # 10 bars ago current
128 #
129 # CV = ((3.5 - 2.0) / 2.0) × 100 = 75%
130 # Volatility has expanded 75% compared to 10 bars ago!
131 # -------------------------------------------------------------
132 for i in range(len(candles)):
133​
134 # -------------------------------------------------------------
135 # Logic Step 5.1: Insufficient History Check
136 #
137 # [Decision]
138 # Do we have enough history for ROC and valid EMA?
139 #
140 # [True Branch: Insufficient]
141 # Append None.
142 #
143 # [False Branch: Calculate]
144 # Compute ROC.
145 # -------------------------------------------------------------
146 if (i < self.roc_period or
147 ema[i] is None or
148 ema[i - self.roc_period] is None or
149 ema[i - self.roc_period] == 0):
150 self.values.append(None)
151 continue
152​
153 # -------------------------------------------------------------
154 # Logic Step 5.2: Calculate CV Percentage
155 #
156 # [How] (Logic)
157 # ((Current - Past) / Past) * 100
158 # -------------------------------------------------------------
159 cv = ((ema[i] - ema[i - self.roc_period]) / ema[i - self.roc_period]) * 100
160 self.values.append(cv)
161​
162​
163 # =============================================================================
164 # IPO: _calc_ema (Private Helper)
165 # =============================================================================
166 #
167 # [Input]
168 # - prices: list[float] - Source values
169 # - period: int - EMA period
170 #
171 # [Process]
172 # - Standard EMA with SMA initialization.
173 #
174 # [Output]
175 # - list[float|None] - EMA values
176 #
177 # [Why This Approach?]
178 # Standard exponential smoothing.
179 # =============================================================================
180 def _calc_ema(self, prices, period):
181 results = []
182 k = 2.0 / (period + 1) # EMA multiplier
183 prev_ema = None
184​
185 # -------------------------------------------------------------
186 # Logic Step 1: Main EMA Loop
187 #
188 # [Visual]
189 # period = 3
190 # In: [10, 11, 12, 11]
191 # i=0,1: None
192 # i=2: SMA(10,11,12)=11 (Seed)
193 # i=3: (11-11)*k + 11 = 11
194 # -------------------------------------------------------------
195 for i in range(len(prices)):
196​
197 # -------------------------------------------------------------
198 # Logic Step 1.1: Insufficient Data
199 # -------------------------------------------------------------
200 if i < period - 1:
201 results.append(None)
202 continue
203​
204 # -------------------------------------------------------------
205 # Logic Step 1.2: First EMA (SMA seed)
206 # -------------------------------------------------------------
207 if i == period - 1:
208 s = sum(prices[i - j] for j in range(period))
209 prev_ema = s / period
210 results.append(prev_ema)
211 continue
212​
213 # -------------------------------------------------------------
214 # Logic Step 1.3: Recursive EMA
215 # -------------------------------------------------------------
216 if prev_ema is not None:
217 ema = (prices[i] - prev_ema) * k + prev_ema
218 results.append(ema)
219 prev_ema = ema
220 else:
221 # Should not happen if logic holds, but safe guard
222 results.append(None)
223​
224 return results
225​
226​
227# =============================================================================
228# Static Wrapper Function: calculate
229# =============================================================================
230#
231# [Why]
232# Functional interface.
233#
234# [Pattern: 3-Step Static Wrapper]
235# =============================================================================
236def calculate(candles, ema_period=10, roc_period=10):
237 # 1. Instantiation
238 cv = ChaikinVolatility(ema_period, roc_period)
239​
240 # 2. Execution
241 cv.calculate(candles)
242​
243 # 3. Extraction
244 return cv.values
